P-EBT is for children 5-18 years old who received SNAP food benefits for the month of March 2020 and children up to 21 years old who are certified for free or reduced-price meals at school in Texas during the 2019-20 school year. Children that attend a school that offers free meals to all students (Community Eligibility Provision or Provision 2) are also eligible.

SCHOOL CLOSED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE 2019-2020 SCHOOL YEAR
During Governor Greg Abbott’s address to the state on Friday, he made the executive order to officially close school for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year.

LISD Superintendent Lynn Torres said, “We will continue to provide meals and curriculum to our students throughout the month of May and will discuss with Mike Morath, the Commissioner of the Texas Education Agency, on how we will conduct our graduation. Although it saddens me that we will not have the chance to see our students again this school year, I agree with the governor that the safety and well-being of our staff and students is of the utmost importance. We are here for our students, and our teachers will continue to teach classes virtually and through our website LufkinLearns@Home that can be accessed at www.lufkinisd.org. Stay safe in the coming months, and we look forward to being together again in the coming school year.”

For more information on the Governor’s executive orders, log on to: gov.texas.gov

LMS STEM STUDENTS ADOPT A SECOND GRADE
The Lufkin Middle School 6th grade STEM students participated in the Adopt a Second Grade event today. The topic for the event was “Structure and Properties of Matter.” The students enjoyed being mentors and demonstrating their leadership skills to the 2nd graders. The LMS students took lessons to Herty Primary, Burley Primary, Trout Primary, Dunbar Primary, Kurth Primary, and Slack Elementary.
